data.description:
Mythic Realms invites you to transcend the boundaries of your world and enter a realm of endless possibilities. Unearth the mysteries of the MR game world colliding with your own, and uncover the truth behind why they are colliding.

Mythic Realms is still early in development, and we're putting out a demo so players can help shape the future of the game as we keep working on it. Help us by joining our discord via the website link below and letting us know what you think. Your feedback is incredibly important to us.

DEMO FEATURES: 
• Mixed Reality: Seamlessly blend your reality with a mystical realm as you use your device to interact with objects and characters from both worlds. Experience the wonder of worlds colliding and witness monsters crossing over into your surroundings.
• Dynamic Gameplay: Whether you're battling fearsome creatures in your living room or building a kingdom in VR mode, there are plenty of interactive activities to keep you occupied.
• Build Mode: Build the kingdom of your dreams in MR mode, and then travel into that world, and get immersed in the kingdom you designed by experiencing it in VR mode.
• Foes: Sharpen and upgrade your weapons to defeat waves of enemies.
• Creativity: Immerse yourself in a visually stunning world that seamlessly blends fantasy with reality. Build a kingdom, forge for materials, and upgrade your weapons through smithing.
• Ascend as a Hero: Strengthen your character by leveling up various skills.

MORE FEATURES TO COME!

changelog.change_log: Note: This demo is now outdated. For the latest updates on Mythic Realms, and for a chance to playtest the newest version, join our Discord! You can find the link in our Linktree linked in the description below.

Store fronts added where you can now buy items (lumber mill, blacksmith, and training grounds) now have a shop where items spawn periodically to buy
Newly added sell area where you can place equipment / resources to trade for gold
Enemy archers now have a chance to drop a bow which you can use to get a sneak peek at our ranged combat
Bows can also be periodically be found in lumbermill and training ground shops
Setting options for teleport movement, fixed rotation, and vignette toggle
The flow of smelting has been re-worked to require logs and takes time to finish
The ideal gameplay involves placing ores into the furnace, making sure there’s enough fuel (logs) to power the furnace, and checking back between expeditions to collect the finished bars
Fixed issue with hooded figure spawning too closely to the tutorial tree zone
Improvements to inventory UI + making it clearer when something is selected
Player HUD which shows health and currently equipped items
A bunch of interactables can now be properly grabbed by LT/RG in the same way they were grabble with RT/RG
Enemies can now climb onto and jump off of furniture

Patch 0.3.6

Expedition (Passthrough) Improvements
• We've fine-tuned how encounters and enemies appear within your guardian boundary. This means you'll have a more immersive and enjoyable experience as you explore your surroundings. You’ll notice zones, enemies, and interactable objects now consider the guardian when looking for free space. Zones can now appear on top of beds, tables, couches if set up manually. Anything interactable will now also consider your height, they will try not to be placed above your eye level.
• [Quest 3] We've made sure that encounter spawning avoids potential interference with objects detected during your room scan. This makes your Mythic Realms adventure even smoother and more worry-free.
• We've spruced up your passthrough experience with improved environmental visuals. This will make transitioning between the real and virtual worlds feel more seamless and engaging.

Kingdom Improvements
• Shadows in the kingdom are now enabled.

User Interface Improvements
• The personal screen dock now has depth enabled buttons, making it much easier to see when you tap them.

Bug Fixes
• There was an issue when the device went to sleep that would cause objects to shift when resumed, now on resume this is refreshed with data from the new session.
• Some of the user interface, animations, and interactions could break when timescale changed (personal menu opening), these now will use unscaled time to allow for them to work correctly.
• Other smaller fixes and improvements

Quest 3 Controller Support
Improvements to Slime encounter pathing
Improvements to starting encounters; no longer instantly started, and can auto-equip relevant tool
Other bug fixes

Completely re-worked visuals
New ranged enemy
Better progression + new items
Quest improvements (randomly generated quests from 8 templates)
Added callouts for upcoming features (i.e. shopkeeper, expedition types)
Improvements to Skeleton AI behavior
Improvements to UI + functionality throughout
